Hello I'm tryign to run the documentBuilder01 on Ubuntu with Mono 5.16, and it failed with CheckIsReadOnly(), here is the Stacktrace : 

System.IO.Packaging.Package.CheckIsReadOnly() in 
System.IO.Packaging.Package.CreatePart(System.Uri partUri, string contentType, System.IO.Packaging.CompressionOption compressionOption) in 
DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.OpenXmlPackage.CreateMetroPart(System.Uri partUri, string contentType) in 
DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.OpenXmlPart.CreateInternal(DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.WordprocessingDocument openXmlPackage, DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.OpenXmlPart parent, string contentType, string targetExt) in 
DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.OpenXmlPartContainer.InitPart<DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.CoreFilePropertiesPart>(DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.CoreFilePropertiesPart newPart, string contentType, string id) in 
DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.OpenXmlPartContainer.InitPart<DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.CoreFilePropertiesPart>(DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.CoreFilePropertiesPart newPart, string contentType) in 
DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.WordprocessingDocument.AddCoreFilePropertiesPart() in 
OpenXmlPowerTools.DocumentBuilder.CopyStartingParts(DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.WordprocessingDocument sourceDocument, DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.WordprocessingDocument newDocument, System.Collections.Generic.List<OpenXmlPowerTools.ImageData> images) in 
OpenXmlPowerTools.DocumentBuilder.BuildDocument(System.Collections.Generic.List<OpenXmlPowerTools.Source> sources, DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.WordprocessingDocument output) in 
OpenXmlPowerTools.DocumentBuilder.BuildDocument(System.Collections.Generic.List<OpenXmlPowerTools.Source> sources, string fileName) in 
MergeHeaderAndDocument.MainClass.Main(string[] args) in /home/jpldev/Projects/merge/merge/Program.cs:32

Then I tried to bundle the generated executable using [mkbundle](https://www.mono-project.com/docs/tools+libraries/tools/mkbundle/) and I get the following error : 

```
ERROR: Unable to load assembly `Microsoft.Management.Infrastructure' referenced by 
`/home/jpldev/Projects/merge/merge/bin/Debug/System.Management.Automation.dll'
```

So does this work on Windows only ? Or can it run on Linux ? 

Thanks in advance!
